basic.description:
An introduction to two subjects which together with MATH 401/3.0 provide an entry into discrete mathematics and its applications. Among the enumeration techniques covered are inclusion-exclusion, recurrence relations, and generating functions. The study of designs includes finite geometries and Latin squares. Given jointly with MATH 802/3.0.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;84P)
RECOMMENDATION    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Combinatorics:Enumeration and Designs

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
Prerequisites     MATH210 or MATH211 or MATH212 or MATH217.
